basics.name: Christina Mende
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall 2024.

highlights: Planned and implemented lessons in Mathematics according to Learning Outcomes
Applied various teaching aids to instruct and motivate students
Used learning assessments to regularly monitor student understanding and class concepts
Pi-Day Committee Co-Chair: A yearly event to promote interest in Mathematics and Pie.

work.summary: Teaching Assistant for the Mathematics Department
highlights: Checked assignments, proctored exams, and graded assignments according to university standards
Prepared lessons according to course learning outcomes to teach required material
Taught small groups of students (recitations) focused on specific parts of their corresponding class.

work.summary: Mathematics tutor at Leeward CC's Math Lab
highlights: Tutored students in Mathematics primarily from Pre-Algebra to Calculus IV
Created Math handouts and problem worksheets for student use
Helped implement and maintain a new login system using Excel
Nominated for Student Employee of the Year 2010, 2011, and 2012

awards.title: Master Student Marshal
awards.summary: Honor for outstanding achievement as a graduate student. Student marshal leads the procession of Master degree candidates at the commencement ceremony.

awards.title: Kern-Clark Memorial Award
awards.summary: Annual award for undergraduates whose performance in their mathematics classes has been outstanding.
